materials.raw_text: Cd: 160 g, Co: 80 g, Cu: 40 g, La: 640 g, Tc: 40 g

sourcing.instructions: Cd: Chemical supply stores, Co: Metal suppliers, Cu: Hardware stores, La: Rare earth element suppliers, Tc: Specialized nuclear material suppliers (ensure legal compliance)
steps: Cd: Chemical supply stores, Co: Metal suppliers, Cu: Hardware stores, La: Rare earth element suppliers, Tc: Specialized nuclear material suppliers (ensure legal compliance)

1. Measure out 160 g of Cadmium (Cd), 80 g of Cobalt (Co), 40 g of Copper (Cu), 640 g of Lanthanum (La), and 40 g of Technetium (Tc). 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured metals uniformly. 3. Use a mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure even distribution of the components.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 160 g of Cadmium (Cd), 80 g of Cobalt (Co), 40 g of Copper (Cu), 640 g of Lanthanum (La), and 40 g of Technetium (Tc). 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured metals uniformly. 3. Use a mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure even distribution of the components.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed material to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1000°C for 2 hours to promote alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed material to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1000°C for 2 hours to promote alloy formation.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature, approximately 24 hours. 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature, approximately 24 hours. 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder to smooth out any rough edges and achieve the desired dimensions. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant suitable for metals to prevent oxidation and enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder to smooth out any rough edges and achieve the desired dimensions. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant suitable for metals to prevent oxidation and enhance durability.
